messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] kozuka question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/7/2004 4:00:45 PM Central Standard Time, jggilbert@EARTHLINK.NET writes: Milt, I ve been out of town for a while.  The color of the base
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/7/2004 4:00:45 PM Central Standard Time,
jggilbert@... writes:
Milt,
I've been out of town for a while. The color of the base metal and the
rubbed gold overlay look like what's found in the so-called Ezo fittings. Most of
these are menuki and saya kanemono, some of which are quite old. I can't
recall seeing an Ezo kozuka. It'd be an interesting piece to see in person. We
had a nice pair of Ezo menuki at the London shinsa that were assigned to the
early Muromachi period.

Jim
thanks Jim !!
Will bring to Sept Chicago shinsa und find out once and for all.

milt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] kozuka question
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, I ve been out of town for a while.  The color of the base metal and the rubbed gold overlay look like what s found in the so-called Ezo fittings.  Most
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
I've been out of town for a while. The color of the base metal and the rubbed gold overlay look like what's found in the so-called Ezo fittings. Most of these are menuki and saya kanemono, some of which are quite old. I can't recall seeing an Ezo kozuka. It'd be an interesting piece to see in person. We had a nice pair of Ezo menuki at the London shinsa that were assigned to the early Muromachi period.

Jim



please klick............

http://tinyurl.com/2voxv


Have this small size kozuka ( looks like it's made of shuibuchi with
gildings )for a while .
Can anyone suggest school, jidai ?

thank you all in advance.

milt
